reviewText: Hammer, known for its horror films, made three Robin Hood movies, of which this is the first and least.  Director Val Guest made a number of far better films, and American Don Taylor is a poor substitute for Errol Flynn.  The problem is compounded by Nostalgia Familys muddy, dupey-looking transfer (from VHS?), and a soundtrack plagued by sync issues and a persistent hum.  On the positive side, the DVD is certainly cheap, and would probably look OK on a small screen.  For Robin Hood completists only.
